intro: Brunfelsia hydrangeiformis var. angustifoliaglabriscula, commonly known as the narrow-leaved bracken bell, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are generally smooth and glabrous. The plant produces clusters of showy, bell-shaped flowers in shades of white, pink, or purple. These flowers are typically borne on long, drooping peduncles, giving the plant a distinctive appearance. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
